column1: File:Eric David Anderson - Michel Delving.jpg - Michel Delving
Michel Delving was the chief town of the Shire.  It was located in the White Downs that lay within the Westfarthing on the East Road
column2: perhaps south to its smaller counterpart
column3: the Little Delving.  Although located within a hilly region the town had many above-ground houses of wood

column1: This large town was unofficially considered to be more or less the Hobbits "capital".  The Mayor of Michel Delving (or of the Shire) was the only real official in the Shire
column2: under whom were attached the offices of Postmaster and First Shirriff for the entire region.
the museum known as the Mathom-house
column3: as well as the storage tunnels later known as Lockholes
column4: could be found in Michel Delving.

column1: On 4 November  Frodo Baggins rode to Michel Delving and released the prisoners from the Lockholes.

column2: being derived from a possible Old English Micel Delfing..

column1: Michel and mickle- (cf. Mickleburg) are derived from the Old English Wiktionary:micel
